description.narrative: Indaba Agricultural Policy Research Institute (IAPRI) completed analysis and dissemination of various research outputs in the agricultural sector that directly informed debates related to agricultural development in Zambia.These works are ingredients that the country can use to formulate policies that can hasten broad-based sustainable agricultural growth and rural poverty reduction. During the reporting period, IAPRI reported the progress made towards the fulfilment of the high level indicators as indicated in the agreed results framework. The following are some of the reported achievements; 1. IAPRI revealed that due to their skills, they were able to establish the current status of Climate Smart Agriculture in Zambia (CSA). The processed data from RALs indicate that CSA has increased by 1.1% and 1.8% in areas with long standing history of CA promotion. 2. IAPRI reported that due to their advocacy work, there was an increase of private sector participation in the purchases of maize eg in 2017, it was reported that the private sector purchased about 51.6% of the total reported purchases. 3. IAPRI reported that it contributed to the improved agricultural policy environment through its various interactions. eg the GRZ adopted 100% in the distribution of agricultural inputs through e-voucher country wide. IAPRI attributed this to the many discussion forums that they organised. 4.IAPRI facilitated various platforms that hosted a number of outreach activities with different stakeholders and at different forums to discuss agricultural policy related issues e.g with parliamentarians, provincial level technical staff etc.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
